intro: Sutera archeri, commonly known as the silver leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and bell-shaped flowers. The leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water, which makes it drought-tolerant. It produces small, pale blue or white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is often cultivated as an ornamental due to its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements.
